instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3023 no water damage. light on MG. Fan spin. No chime. No image.
threads.message:
Hi there,

No signs of water damage. Customer says started beeping and switched off. After that does not turn on anymore.

no water damage. light on MG. Fan spin. No chime. No image.

PPBUS_G3H - 8.4V

P3V42_G3H - 3.42V

L7260 - 3.3v

L9701 - 0v

L3895 - 0.2v

L7220 - 5.1v

L7100 - 0.9v

L7630 - 1v

L7330 - 1.5v

L7550 - 0v

L7510 - 1.2v

Please advise how to proceed. Something tells its not gonna be an easy one.

Thanks!

threads.title: 820-3023 no water damage. light on MG. Fan spin. No chime. No image.
threads.message:
If started beeping, that is sign of RAM, or CPU issue.
Heat RAM and CPU for test.
You can also try to burn eventually accumulated crap; use quality flux.

threads.title: 820-3023 no water damage. light on MG. Fan spin. No chime. No image.
threads.message: If it's beeping, this is trash. Dead CPU, dead PCH, dead RAM, broken internal trace etc. Waste of time.

threads.title: 820-3023 no water damage. light on MG. Fan spin. No chime. No image.
threads.message:
It beeped when it died according to the customer.
when i test it, It does not beep.
Will try heating ram and cpu and burning crap.
